name: trespasser
content:
trespasser noun [C]
(CRIMINAL)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a person who goes onto someone's land or enters their building without permission: Can't you read the sign? It says "Trespassers will be prosecuted!" A sign warns trespassers they may be shot.
More examplesFewer examplesBurglars, trespassers, and even hardened criminals must be guaranteed basic rights.He and his colleagues are constantly frustrated by persistent vandals and trespassers.They're on special lookout for thieves and trespassers.

trespasser noun [C]
(IMMORAL PERSON)
a person who does something or acts in a way that is not morally acceptable: Forgiveness can only take place when the trespasser is repentant. They would stand on the pavements singing hymns, while the sinning trespasser was being verbally abused. See
trespass
More examplesFewer examplesThe man who steals is often less of a moral trespasser than the man who gives.The trespasser intended to end another's life, but he has only destroyed his own.
